title: MySQL memcached Plugin Integer Underflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of MySQL. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the processing of Authentication commands in the memcached plugin. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in an integer underflow before writing to memory. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the service account.
addtionnal_details: Oracle has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujul2021.html
timeline:
2021-03-10 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2021-07-22 - Coordinated public release of advisory
